TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit RouteBase extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for all classes that represent an ASP.NET route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteBase> class enables you to create customized classes for defining routes in your application. Typically, you will use the <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> class when you define routes. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteBase> class. However, if you want to provide different functionality than what is provided by the <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> class, you create a class that derives from <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteBase> and implement the properties and methods that you need.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.Routing.RouteData GetRouteData(class System.Web.HttpContextBase httpContext) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetRouteData (httpContext As HttpContextBase) As RouteData

Docs.param: An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns route information about the request.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the values from the route definition if the route matches the current request, or if the route does not match the request.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData GetVirtualPath (System.Web.Routing.RequestContext requestContext, System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary values);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData GetVirtualPath(class System.Web.Routing.RequestContext requestContext, class System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary values) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetVirtualPath (requestContext As RequestContext, values As RouteValueDictionary) As VirtualPathData
abstract member GetVirtualPath : System.Web.Routing.RequestContext * System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary -> System.Web.Routing.VirtualPathData

Docs.param: An object that encapsulates information about the requested route.
An object that contains the parameters for a route.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, checks whether the route matches the specified values, and if so, generates a URL and retrieves information about the route.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the generated URL and information about the route, or if the route does not match .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To generate a URL, you use the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection> class. That method calls the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteBase.GetVirtualPath%2A> method for each route in the collection to determine whether that route matches the values in `values` and can therefore generate the URL.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RouteExistingFiles { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RouteExistingFiles : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether ASP.NET routing should handle URLs that match an existing file.
Docs.value: if ASP.NET routing handles all requests, even those that match an existing file; otherwise, . The default value is .
